pr_title: Binarydata api update - Default json serializer

timeline.bodyText: @JonathanGiles, @srnagar, I'd like to see us create a guideline around the default serializer to be used when one isn't passed. In some locations we use JsonSerializer/ObjectSerializer and in others we default to using JacksonAdapter. I have a feeling we may need to go down the route of always falling back to JacksonAdapter, except with serialization formats we didn't previously support such as Avro and Protobuf, as using JsonSerializerProviders.createInstance may result in customer applications throwing an exception when they previously didn't. This restriction may only apply to logic in azure-core which could accept an ObjectSerializer/JsonSerializer as it cannot take a dependency on the implementation libraries.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText:
Possible guidance:
If azure-core or retrofitting a library, either we cannot accept a null serializer type or we default to JacksonAdapter. Reasoning is that we may introduce exceptions into a customer's application that weren't previously being thrown.
If a new library, leverage JsonSerializerProviders.createInstance(), and other serializer providers that come in the future, as the default and include a dependency for the default implementation. Reasoning is that it is a new library and should adhere to the best practices for allowing customer configuration of serialization.
replies.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: Set up a meeting for next week and we can discuss this and work on some guidelines text.
